subject: Delegation Powers to Regional Officers for deciding the claim arising out of overstay of User Fee Collection Agency (UFCA) beyond Contractual extension period and for claim beyond the contractual period allowed after the premature termination request invoked by User Fee Collection Agencies
text: grally 70 ~THRf 9ifea5ru (Tsa5 @de7 & RTTHPf HATT4, HRG  FRGR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Hcra J #fl-5 & 6, Raer-10, arql;, #f faaft 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 TMI /Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Commercial Operations/2024 Policy Circular No.17.6.10/2024 dated 24th June, 2024 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. CODIV-11036/3/2024-CO Division (Comp. No. 250322)} Sub: Delegation Powers to Regional Officers for deciding the claim arising out of overstay of User Fee Collection Agency (UFCA) beyond Contractual extension period and for claim beyond the contractual   period allowed after the premature termination request invoked by User Fee Collection Agencies reg: The Executive Committee in its 617th meeting dated 07.06.2024 has approved the Delegation of Powers to Regional Officers to handle claims arising from the overstay of User Fee Collection Agencies at Fee Plazas beyond the contractual extension period and for claims beyond the period allowed for various reasons such as premature termination, non- finalisation of New Agency etc. 2 To address claims related to the overstay of User Fee Collection Agencies and premature termination requests, the calculation as per following methodology has been approved: The compensation will be payable for the lowest amount of the following two methods: Method-1: Differential Amount between Old and New Contract remittances: Compensation = (X-Y) * N Where: X = Agreed remittance per of existing Agency (Old Contract) Y Agreed remittance per quoted by New Agency (New Contract) N Number of days for which existing Agency overstayed at the Fee Plaza beyond Contractual extension period [in accordance with Clause 2(ii)] Method-2: Differential Amount based on Actual Collection. Compensation A 0.85 x B Where: A Total Agreed remittance of existing Agency for overstay period (Old Contract) B Total Actual Collection (ETC + Cash Monthly /Daily Pass) during the overstay period. Administrative expenses are considered as 10% of the Actual Collection, and the Contractors profit is considered as 5% of the Actual Collection. 3_ The Authority to handle these claims is hereby delegated to the respective Regional Officers. This Delegation aims to expedite the claims process, reduce delays and ensure timely release of performance securities. Contd__2I - M 7 7 9 NHAL day day
